[What is the Mochary Method?]() (1min)

[Video of Adam Donkin explaining the core of the Mochary Method](https://www.loom.com/share/a38b690820bd452d94fdb691829b05ae?sid=e55b4257-e329-4432-99b0-828f4b7393ba)

When we start coaching, we often hear the question,

**“What is the Mochary Method?”**

It’s a set of tools and processes for teams that deliver:

- Accountability

  - Ensures each person is working on the most important thing
  - Ensures each person is doing the things they say they are going to do

- Decision-making

  - Identifies the biggest issues, and forces a decision to be made

- Transparency
  - All team members can see what all other team members are focused on
  - Everyone gets and receives feedback on their performance and behaviors … regularly\!

We achieve this through a straightforward, repeatable, **action-oriented** process.

![][image1]

- **Review**

  - **Actions**—declare if you did the things you said you would
  - **Goals**—declare status of each priority, and **next action** toward each.

- **Issues**—make decisions and commit to **next actions**

- **Feedback**—give and receive feedback; if you accept the feedback, create a **next action** to address it

Our 1:1s, group meetings and working sessions use this structure to consistently speed us toward accomplishing our goals while building trust and transparency across the team.

[image1]: data:image/png;base64,
